thread.title: Mother Gentoo Penguin Feeding Her Chick at Port Lockroy, Antarctica

author: Gary
title: Mother Gentoo Penguin Feeding Her Chick at Port Lockroy, Antarctica
text:
Mother Gentoo Penguin Feeding Her Chick at Port Lockroy, Antarctica 
Camera NIKON D200 Aperture f/5.6 Exposure Time 1/20 
Port Lockroy is a British Base in Antarctica and it is also home to the world’s southernmost post office. I actually sent a postcard from there which got an antarctica postmark on it! (It took six months to be delivered, however.) 
Penguins at taken over the exposed land all around the base and I was able to get some great, up close shots of penguin feeding behavior. I waited patiently to get shots of penguins feeding their chicks. 
Gentoo penguins usually have 2 chicks each season, of which only 1 usually survives to maturity. Get My FREE 100 Page Travel Photography eBook! 
2 Responses to "Mother Gentoo Penguin Feeding Her Chick at Port Lockroy, Antarctica" By Alamir Travel September 5, 2015 - 1:36 am 
We need to protect this beauty … By Rashid Al Ruhi September 4, 2015 - 9:30 pm
